name: The Blessed Virgin Mary
description: (1st century) is venerated as the Mother of God and holds a special place in Christian tradition. Born to Sts. Joachim and Anne, she is celebrated for her role in salvation, including her divine motherhood, perpetual virginity, and assumption into heaven. The Catholic Church honors her with numerous feasts, including the Assumption and Immaculate Conception. Mary's life, as depicted in the Gospels, showcases her pivotal presence alongside Jesus, from his birth to his crucifixion.
